name: National Dog Day
description: As if every day doesn't feel like National Dog Day, the official day, first celebrated in 2004, is August 26!

name: Women's Equality Day
description: Women’s Equality Day commemorates the passage of the 19th Amendment to the U.S. Constitution, granting the right to vote to women. In 1971, the U.S. Congress designated August 26 as Women’s Equality Day.

name: National Beach Day
description: Started in  2014,  this holiday raises our awareness of the beauty of  beaches while also calling attention to keeping them clean and safe.

name: U.S. Bowling League Day
description: Each year on September 3rd, bowlers across the country lace up their bowling shoes and celebrate U.S. Bowling League Day.

name: National Cheese Pizza Day
description: There are many favorites in the pizza world, but only one classic is celebrated on September 5. Step aside toppings, it's National Cheese Pizza Day.

name: Labor Day
description: Labor Day is celebrated on the first Monday in September. The holiday aims to honor and recognize the American labor movement and often noted as the unofficial end of summer.

name: Rosh Hashanah
description: Rosh Hashanah, meaning “beginning of the year,” is the Jewish New Year. The holiday is an extremely joyous occasion consisting of two days of celebration, starting at sunset on Friday and ending at sunset on Sunday.

name: National Read A Book Day
description: Cozy up in a big chair, lounge by the pool, or visit your local library -- September 6 is National Read A Book Day.

name: 9/11 (Patriot Day)
description: Sept. 11, 2001, a series of four terrorist attacks by the Islamic extremist group, al-Qaida, were led against the U.S. This day, many memorials exist to commemorate those lost in the attacks, and the day is generally somber in nature.

name: National Grandparents Day
description: September 12 is a day to spend time with Grandparents, listen to their stories, give gifts, and more!

name: Yom Kippur
description: Yom Kippur, meaning "Day of Atonement," is one of the most important dates on the Jewish calendar.  Traditionally, it's observed through fasting, prayer and reflection, and attending synagogue services.

name: National Linguine Day
description: Made from durum semolina flour, linguine is one of the world’s oldest kinds of pasta. Celebrate this classic with a new sauce or recipe.

name: National Guacamole Day
description: This versatile dish is a favorite at any table. Enjoy it with chips or as a topping on National Guacamole Day.

name: National Cheeseburger Day
description: Light up the grill or visit a local burger joint, September 18 celebrates everyone's favorite classic cheeseburger.

name: National CleanUp Day
description: On this day, organizations and individuals around the country celebrate National CleanUp Day, with efforts aimed at reducing litter and cleaning up their local communities, parks, trails, beaches, and open spaces. Keep the outdoors clean by volunteering time to collect trash and beautify your neighborhoods and green spaces.

name: Fall Equinox
description: The Autumn Equinox used to signify the end of the harvest. Nowadays, it means it's time to head outside and take in the beauty of the changing leaves before winter rushes in.
